heisig_chinese_memo: The class dunce plans class pranks before he get some shuteye at home on his bunk beds.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: After work, the French maid goes home and lies down with a turtle to get some shuteye. Turtle? Well, he's sloooow and always hard... (thanks to Nukemarine and Wakela!).
humanum_full_description_en:
A bronze inscription from " the Rock from" " broom ", " broom " like a broom, as the house cleaning, for Italian residence resting place, is "寢", " sleep beginning of the text" of. The original meaning is dormitory. The Chu characters of the Warring States Period are added next to "爿" (the first text of " bed ") to strengthen the meaning of residence (Ji Xusheng).

Tang Lan believes " broom " ancient read as " invasion " is "寢", " sleep sound symbol" Regardless prepare a say.

The oracle bone inscriptions were the residence of the king of Shang, and sacrifices were also held in the bed. Bronze inscription means palace dormitory and living room, Mai Zun: "Wang Yihou (enter) in 𡨦". It also means that the temple is sleeping, and the teacher is Fang Yi: "Wang Cai (in) Zhou Kang 𡨦 Township (飨) Li." Also used as the official name, 顨簋: "Wang Yi (Gi) 𡨦 fish shell". The book is like a copper 鼋: "Wang Ling (ming) 𡨦 Kui brother (wish) is like a book."

" Invasion " is used as " sleeping " in Han silk script. " Invasion " and " sleeping " are homonymous. "Mawangdui silk script. "Ten Questions" "Do not hear the ears, and invade (sleep) with peace."

" Sleep " with "寢", Chinese for " 𠖗 ." "Said the text": "寢, lying down. From the sound of the 宀㑴. 𠖗, the text of the province."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jinwen means cleaning in the house to provide residence. The original meaning is dormitory.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「宀」從「帚」，「帚」象掃帚，象在屋內打掃，以供居息之意，是「寑」、「寢」的初文。本義是寢室。戰國楚文字加「爿」(「牀」的初文)旁，加強居息之意(季旭昇)。

　　唐蘭認為「帚」古讀如「侵」，是「寑」、「寢」的聲符，姑備一說。

　　甲骨文是商王的居所，亦在寢中舉行祭祀。金文表示宮寢、居室，麥尊：「王以侯內(入)于𡨦」。又表示廟寢，師遽方彝：「王才(在)周康𡨦鄉(饗)醴。」又用作職官名，𡨦魚簋：「王易(賜)𡨦魚貝」。作冊般銅黿：「王令(命)𡨦馗兄(祝)于乍(作)冊般」。

　　漢帛書以「侵」為「寢」，「侵」、「寢」同音，《馬王堆帛書．十問》「使耳勿聞，且以安侵(寢)。」

　　「寢」同「寑」，異體作「𠖗」。《說文》：「寑，臥也。从宀㑴聲。𠖗，籒文寑省。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文表示在屋內打掃，以供居息，本義是寢室。

甲金文從「 宀 」從「 帚 」，「 帚 」象掃帚，象在屋內打掃，以供居息之意，是「 寑 」、「 寢 」的初文。本義是寢室。戰國楚文字加「 爿 」(「 牀 」的初文)旁，加強居息之意(季旭昇)。 唐蘭認為「 帚 」古讀如「 侵 」，是「 寑 」、「 寢 」的聲符，姑備一說。 甲骨文是商王的居所，亦在寢中舉行祭祀。金文表示宮寢、居室，麥尊：「王以侯內(入)于𡨦」。又表示廟寢，師遽方彝：「王才(在)周康𡨦鄉(饗)醴。」又用作職官名，𡨦魚簋：「王易(賜)𡨦魚貝」。作冊般銅黿：「王令(命)𡨦馗兄(祝)于乍(作)冊般」。 漢帛書以「 侵 」為「 寢 」，「 侵 」、「 寢 」同音，《馬王堆帛書．十問》「使耳勿聞，且以安侵(寢)。」 「 寢 」同「 寑 」，異體作「 𠖗 」。《說文》：「寑，臥也。从宀㑴聲。𠖗，籒文寑省。」

Tang Lan believes " broom" ancient read as " invasion" is " 寢", " sleep sound symbol" Regardless prepare a say. The oracle bone inscriptions were the residence of the king of Shang, and sacrifices were also held in the bed. Bronze inscription means palace dormitory and living room, Mai Zun: "Wang Yihou (enter) in 𡨦". It also means that the temple is sleeping, and the teacher is Fang Yi: "Wang Cai (in) Zhou Kang 𡨦 Township (飨) Li." Also used as the official name, 顨簋: "Wang Yi (Gi) 𡨦 fish shell". 寢字的基本解释

寢
qǐn
见“寝”。

寢字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qǐn］
［《廣韻》七稔切，上寢，清。］
亦作“寑1”。亦作“1”。“寝1”的繁体字。
(1)睡；卧。
(2)引申为物体横放着。参见“寢石”。
(3)寝宫；卧室。
(4)古代帝王宗庙之后殿，为放置祖宗衣冠之处。
(5)指陵寝。秦汉以后帝王陵墓上的正殿。
(6)止息；废置。
(7)谓湮没不彰；隐蔽。
(8)丑陋。
(9)通“寖”。逐渐。
(10)通“祲”。使盛大。

寢字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【宀字部】　寢； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页290第22
〔古文〕??寑【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?七稔切，侵上聲。【說文】臥也。【詩·小雅】乃寢乃興。【論語】宰予晝寢。　又【廣韻】堂室也。【爾雅·釋宮】無東西廂，有室曰寢。周制，王公六寢，路寢一，小寢五。路寢，冶事之所，小寢，燕息之地也。【公羊傳·莊三十二年】路寢者何，正寢也。　又寢廟。凡廟，前曰廟，後曰寢。【詩·小雅】奕奕寢廟，君子作之。【商頌】寢成孔安。【註】廟中之寢，所以安神也。　又陵寢。【史記·樂書】三代以前，未有墓祭。至秦始出寢，起於墓側。漢因秦制，上陵皆有園寢。　又凡居室皆曰寢。【禮·王制】庶人祭於寢。　又息也。【前漢·?法志】兵寢?措。【唐書·裴度傳】汲黯在朝，淮南寢謀。　又寢丘，縣名，在汝南。【前漢·地理志應劭註】叔敖子所邑之地，後更名固始。　又叶衣檢切，音揜。【詩·小雅】乃安斯寢。叶上簟。簟音忝。　【集韻】亦作?。

寢字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
sleep
qǐn
See "sleeping".
sleep
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qǐn］
["Guang Yun" Qi Min cuts, goes to bed, clears. ]
Also known as "寢1". Also known as "1". Traditional characters for "床1".
(1) Sleeping; lying down.
(2) The extension is that the object is placed horizontally. See "sleeping stone".
(3) The bedroom; the bedroom.
(4) The back hall of the ancient emperor's ancestral temple was the place where the ancestors' clothes were placed.
(5) Refers to the mausoleum. The main hall on the tombs of emperors after the Qin and Han dynasties.
(6) Stop interest; abolish.
(7) It is said that the oblivion is oblivious; it is concealed.
(8) Ugly.
(9) Through "dipping". gradually.
(10) Link "Shu". Make grand.
sleep
